page.title: 14PENJERRICK GARDENS
page.content: Penjerrick gardens was first owned by Robert Were Fox the second (1789-1877). It is said that he was one of the greatest scientists Cornwall has produced.With the help of his daughters, Caroline and Anna-Maria, he founded the Royal Cornwall Polytechnic Society. Penjerrick was one of his homes and now the gardens are open to visitors one day a week.The grounds are full of trees and shrubs including camelias, azaleas,rhododendrons and hydrangeas. A picturesque bridge in the gardens crosses the Budock - Mawnan Smith road into an area known as 'The Wilderness' where there is a lily pond and many different varieties of tropical fern, probably gathered as a result of the family's shipping business.
